public class ECGridView
extends ListView
implements DragSource

ECGridView()
Constructs an empty ListView.
ECGridView(int, int, int, int)
Constructs an empty ListView with the given bounds.
ECGridView(Rect)
Constructs a ListView with bounds rect.

acceptsDrag(DragSession, int, int)
This method will be called on mouse move when dragging is happening, we need it to update areas damaged by dragged image
addObserver(Observer)
Adds Observer to the list of those who will be notified of drag'n'drop event
columnWidth()
Returns the ListView's column width.
dragWasAccepted(DragSession)
DragSource method
dragWasRejected(DragSession)
DragSource method
drawView(Graphics)
Draws the ListView, calling drawViewBackground() to draw each ListItem's background.
itemForPoint(int, int)
Returns the ListItem at the coordinate (x, y).
minSize()
Returns a Size consisting of the current width and the minimum height necessary to accommodate all the rows.
mouseDown(MouseEvent)
Handles mouse down events within the ListView.
mouseDragged(MouseEvent)
Tracks the mouse as the user drags it, selecting and deselecting ListItems as appropriate.
mouseUp(MouseEvent)
Calls sendCommand() on a single click mouse up.
notifier()
Returns Observable notifier IV
rectForItemAt(int)
Returns the Rect for the ListItem at the given row index.
removeAllItems()
Empties the ListView.
removeItem(ListItem)
Removes item from the ListView.
removeItemAt(int)
Removes the ListItem at the given row index.
selectItem(ListItem)
Selects item within the ListView.
setBounds(int, int, int, int)
Redetermines the number of columns that can be displayed.
setColumnWidth(int)
Sets the width of each column in the ListView.
setDragCommand(String)
Allows to mark the dragged object so that drag recipient would be able to identify it, used in mouseDragged
setNumCols(int)
Returns a Size consisting of the current number of columns
sourceView(DragSession)
DragSource method

removeAllItems in class ListView
selectItem 
  public void selectItem(ListItem item)
Selects item within the ListView. If multiple selection is not enabled, any currently selected ListItem is deselected. If item is null, all of the ListView's ListItems are deselected.
Overrides:
selectItem in class ListView
mouseDown 
  public boolean mouseDown(MouseEvent event)
Handles mouse down events within the ListView. This method selects and deselects ListItems as the user clicks on them, and sends the ListView's doubleCommand on a double-click. The normal command is sent in mouseUp().
Overrides:
mouseDown in class ListView
See Also:
setDoubleCommand, mouseUp
setDragCommand 
  public void setDragCommand(String command)
Allows to mark the dragged object so that drag recipient would be able to identify it, used in mouseDragged
See Also:
mouseDragged

Tracks the mouse as the user drags it, selecting and deselecting ListItems as appropriate.
